name: BBCWorld
text:
The highest temperature ever reliably recorded on Earth - 130F (54.4C) - may have been reached in Death Valley National Park, California

[Thread]

https://t.co/Mx5GQfJwj3

name: BBCWorld
text:
Sunday's reading was recorded in Furnace Creek, Death Valley

Before this, the highest temperature reliably recorded on Earth was 129.2F (54C) - also in Death Valley in 2013

https://t.co/Mx5GQfJwj3 https://t.co/A2IY2z9VjV

name: BBCWorld
text:
The recording is being verified by the US National Weather Service

It comes during a heatwave on the west coast, where temperatures are forecast to rise further this week

https://t.co/Mx5GQfJwj3 https://t.co/7eZyN7wkbA

name: BBCWorld
text:
Heatwaves can cause heat cramps, dehydration and even potentially fatal heat strokes

They can also exacerbate pre-existing health conditions, including respiratory diseases, heart conditions and kidney disorders, the World Health Organization says

https://t.co/Mx5GQfJwj3 https://t.co/rPxOeZH8J1

name: BBCWorld
text:
As well as straining power grids and causing blackouts, extreme heat can ground planes, melt roads, and cause the inside of cars to overheat to dangerous levels

They can also have a severe impact on agriculture

https://t.co/Mx5GQfJwj3 https://t.co/XC3nQPqa4p

name: BBCWorld
text: Read more about the incredible temperatures recorded in Death Valley National Park, and the impact of heatwaves on the world: https://t.co/Mx5GQfJwj3
